Title: TC936 - Nutanix Infrastructure
Description: Manchester City Council's Data Centre Strategy defines the migration from the existing single data centre to two new co-location facilities providing a robust and resilient disaster recovery solution to meet specified business RPO and RTO across a range of services and applications. The Council's existing core infrastructure (storage, compute and backup) hardware and software is reaching end of life. The Council therefore has a requirement to replace existing storage, compute and backup systems with new solutions. Around 95% of current workloads are virtualised using VMware ESXi. The Nutanix Enterprise Cloud Platform has been identified as the technology of choice in order to replace existing storage and compute hardware underpinning this virtualisation environment. The Council has a number of workloads that will not be migrated to the Nutanix solution (Oracle Solaris based systems and File Shares) that consume legacy SAN storage. Replacing this SAN storage is out of scope of this tender and will form part of a separate tender. Additionally replacing existing Council data backup and recovery systems are out of scope of this tender and will also form part of a separate tender.
Additional Text: Awarded following a further competition against Crown Commercial Services (CCS) framework Technology Products 2 Lot 3
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Esteem Systems Ltd|Rofta House, Rudgate, Wetherby, LS23 7QA|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: Enterprise-level storage network to attach to Oracle Server estate plus 5 years manufacturers' support
Description:
Tender bids are invited for the provision of a small scale enterprise-level fibre channel storage array network to provide storage to Leicestershire County Council's Oracle Server estate which is located across 2 data centres. The proposed solution must include 5 years full manufacturers' support.

The response should also include an indicative daily rate for technical services should assistance be needed with the installation and commissioning of the proposed solution.

Any proposed solution would be required to integrate with our current operating setup allowing for Solaris containers/zones and LDOMs to be migrated between all physical servers.

Title: RM1054 Technology Products
Description:
Crown Commercial Service as the Contracting Authority has put in place a Pan Government Collaborative Framework Agreement for Technology Products for use by UK public sector bodies (and any future successors to these organisations), which include Central Government Departments and their Arm's Length Bodies and Agencies, Non Departmental Public Bodies, NHS bodies and Local Authorities. Crown Commercial Service reserves the right for an electronic auction to be held by public sector bodies during further competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

Contract Notice reference 2014/S 093-162738 dated 15/05/2014 explains how the range of products covered by this Framework Agreement has been broken down into Lots. This Contract Notice has been included as one of the attachments.

The Contract End Date stated earlier takes into account that the Crown Commercial Service has the option of extending the duration by a  maximum of 2 years. The option to extend can  be taken up on the expiry of the initial 2 year contract period.

Title: Technology Services
Description:
Crown Commercial Service as the Contracting Authority has put in place a Pan Government Collaborative Framework Agreement for use by the UK public sector bodies identified at Section VI.3 in the Contract Notice (supplied as an attachment), and any future successors to those organisations. They  include Central Government Departments and their Arm's Length Bodies and Agencies, Non Departmental Public Bodies, NHS bodies and Local Authorities.

The above mentioned public sector bodies have  a need for a new technology services framework agreement which will deliver local, regional and national technology services through the  lots listed below. We were  particularly looking for specialist suppliers who can provide the services under individual lots as well as suppliers who can provide  multiple services.

Lot 1 Help desk/Service desk
Lot 2 Desktop Support
Lot 3 Network Management
Lot 4 Network and content security
Lot 5 Infrastructure and Platform, Maintenance and Support
Lot 6 Audit services and Asset management
Lot 7 IT Infrastructure Transition Services and Delivery
Lot 8 Service Integration/Service Integrator
Lot 9 Disaster Recovery/ Business Continuity
Lot 10 Backup and Data Services
Lot 11 Asset Disposal 

CPV: 72000000, 72500000.

The duration of the  framework agreement is 18 months but there is an option to extend the duration up to a maximum of a further 6 months.

All stated contract values are estimated. The Contracting Authority has not guaranteed any Supplier a  minimum level of business.
Contact Address 1: Rosebery Court,  St Andrews Business Park
